image.altText: A woman with a tube in her nose and in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: SA women with endometriosis are experiencing long delays in diagnosis and treatment because of problems accessing medical services, as well as a lack of awareness, a parliamentary inquiry finds.

title.children: Endometriosis sufferers experiencing delays in SA for treatment and diagnosis

image.altText: Soursob Bob at Milledge's Distillation

props.synopsis: Milledge's Distillation in the heart of Port Adelaide's commercial district is being taken to court by the local council over what its owners say is a lone noise complaint.

title.children: Popular Adelaide music venue fears closure over single noise complaint

image.altText: A man wearing a T-shirt crossing his arms in front of a bay with seaweed and cliffs

props.synopsis: Similar seawater quality problems to those that have been reported near Victor Harbor are threatening the livelihood of a fisher in the state's south-east.

title.children: SA fisher says 'burning' water harming marine life and business

image.altText: James Bull with his hand in the air as he does a DJ set

props.synopsis: People with disabilities are sometimes turned away from regular nightclubs, where they can be falsely accused of being drunk or made uncomfortable by strobe lighting — but The Heart Beat Club is run by DJs with disabilities, for people with disabilities.

title.children: DJs to spin their way into hearts of Fringe-goers on disability club night

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A mother charged with the attempted murder of her two sons after stabbing them multiple times on an Adelaide motorway has been found not guilty by way of mental incompetence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed her two sons found not guilty by way of mental incompetence

image.altText: A state MP surrounded by journalists outside court.

props.synopsis: Fraud and theft offending by a South Australian MP was fuelled by "greed" and has so far cost him his family home and more than $800,000 in legal fees, a court hears.

title.children: Fraudster MP who stole more than $430k motivated by 'greed', court told

image.altText: A firefighting volunteer wearing a fedora hat

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters and their support staff have travelled more than 1,000 kilometres to help small towns fighting fires in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: Tents, mates, and big breakfasts for travelling volunteers helping firies

image.altText: Three young children jumping in a puddle on an otherwise dry ground with a tractor in the background

props.synopsis: Many South Australians awoke to the almost unfamiliar sound of rain hitting their roofs as parts of Adelaide experienced falls of 10mm, and the state's west recorded even higher totals.

title.children: Adelaide welcomes wettest weather in more than 100 days amid SA rain

image.altText: A chrome coloured crushed ute abandoned on the street in Port Vila's town centre.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu is one of the most disaster-prone nations on the planet, with cyclones, earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. And its people now face an unsettling question: how many disasters can one nation take?

title.children: Vanuatu's capital is a ghost town — some say it might be 'finished'

image.altText: A view of the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: Doctors and nurses say patient care could be compromised if the SA government pushes ahead with plans to shift the infectious diseases unit out of Adelaide’s biggest public hospital and move it to a site across the road.

title.children: Hospital 'Tetris puzzle' could put SA patients at risk, tribunal hears

image.altText: A man stands in front of a white wall in american prison

props.synopsis: Former Adelaide megachurch pastor Daniel Menelaou, who was last week charged in the US with possession of child sexual abuse material, has been banned from working with children in SA.

title.children: Pastor arrested in US for alleged abuse banned from working with children

image.altText: Trucks and car travelling along a major road

props.synopsis: Community calls for a full duplication of the Sturt Highway have been back by South Australia's peak motoring body, which says planning needs to start now for the project to be realised.

title.children: Business owner's pre-election plea for highway duplication and safety

image.altText: Sayet Erhan Akca standing in a gym in a black singlet

props.synopsis: The man is alleged to have helped Sayet Erhan Akca sail from Australia to Thailand in late 2023 to escape drug importation charges.

title.children: Man charged over allegedly smuggling caravan terror hoax suspect out of Australia

image.altText: a female students at an exam table

props.synopsis: International students have been "thrown under the bus" and unfairly blamed for the rental crisis, according to new study.

title.children: 'Thrown under the bus': Study concludes international students not to blame for rising rents

image.altText: A close-up shot of the District Court of WA in Perth, showing signage on the building's front facade with the court's name.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old West Australian man who shared Islamic State beheading videos online becomes the first person convicted under new Commonwealth counter-terrorism laws covering social media use.

title.children: WA man first convicted for sharing violent extremist material online

image.altText: donald trump and a school child hold up signed executive orders

props.synopsis: The order would leave school policy almost entirely in the hands of states and local boards, a prospect that alarms many within the US education system.

title.children: Trump signs order aimed at dismantling US Department of Education

image.altText: A bearded man holds his hand to his forehead

props.synopsis: High-level talks were taking place in London and Brussels on Thursday, as Western allies attempt to boost military aid and security for Ukraine amid continuing aggression from an emboldened Russia.

title.children: EU reiterates Ukraine support as Australia joins high-level London talks

image.altText: Peter Dutton is shown at a press conference. He's wearing glasses and a black suit with an Australian flag behind him.

props.synopsis: It's a weird time when your friends become almost as problematic as your potential enemies, but that's the situation we face.

title.children: Dutton says he could handle Trump, but can any Australian PM?

image.altText: A woman wearing traditional Arab dress walking down a road with two buckets full of supplies.

props.synopsis: Israel's return to fighting in Gaza is forcing the displacement of tens of thousands of Palestinians, as Hamas fires back for the first time since the ceasefire was shattered.

title.children: At least 91 killed in third deadly day of Israeli air strikes in Gaza

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Millie Bobby Browne with long blonde hair looks frightened, a creepy robot behind her shoulder

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's autopen claims, Tasmania's new AFL mascot and egg shortages

image.altText: Sunfish near Albany

props.synopsis: Rarely found in the Southern Ocean, a 2.5-metre sunfish washed up on WA's Lowlands Beach between Denmark and Albany could be a sign of a warm current moving south, a marine ecologist says.

title.children: Giant sunfish washes up on WA's southern coast

image.altText: Graphic of sad woman, hair blowing in the wind, holding her arm across her body.

props.synopsis: Self-criticism, guilt and low self-worth are among the features of a toxic form of self-loathing that can have serious consequences.

title.children: Self-hatred can be crippling — but it can also be treated

image.altText: Festival-goers watch a performance on the stage during the day at Meadow Festival.

props.synopsis: One of the most acclaimed contemporary indie musicians in the world will play this festival in Victoria's south-west on the weekend, but it will be the event's final run as it becomes yet another Australian festival to succumb to financial pressures.

title.children: Joining a long list of shuttered festivals, a local favourite calls time

image.altText: photo being transformed into fat person

props.synopsis: The latest TikTok trend is an AI filter that shows people what they would look like if they were fat.

title.children: An AI fat-filter is trending on TikTok — here's why it can be harmful

image.altText: Hundreds of Muslims outside Lakemba mosque, with the Palestinian flag flying on the front gate.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are investigating a threat made to a mosque in Padstow that references the Christchurch massacre a day after Lakemba Mosque received a similar threat.

title.children: Police investigation into TikTok comment uncovers threat to second mosque

image.altText: A man holds up a sign saying '10 years in limbo' with parliament house out of focus in the background

props.synopsis: A coalition of refugee and human rights groups writes to the leaders of Australia's largest political parties ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Don't demonise asylum seekers, human rights groups warn politicians

image.altText: cactus close up

props.synopsis: Two poorly placed cacti more than 50 years ago have turned into a full-scale invasion. It's prompting calls for people to dispose of their cacti safely to avoid a very prickly problem.

title.children: Two pot plants left behind 60 years ago became a sprawling infestation

image.altText: Kirsty Coventry behind an IOC podium in Greece.

props.synopsis: Two-time gold medallist Kirsty Coventry becomes the International Olympic Committee's first female and African president in its 130-year history.

title.children: Zimbabwean Coventry elected as IOC's first female president

image.altText: George Glezmann, standing in the centre, on an airport tarmac with several other men around him.

props.synopsis: The Taliban has freed an American citizen who had been detained in Afghanistan for more than two years.

title.children: US airline mechanic freed by Taliban after two years' detention

image.altText: Tree uprooted in a carpark.

props.synopsis: One-fifth of all Norfolk Pines assessed on the Gold Coast in the wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred are deemed to be unsafe and will be destroyed.

title.children: At least 50 Norfolk pines to be destroyed after Alfred lashed Gold Coast

image.altText: Nishan Velupillay  celebrates a Socceroos goal against Indonesia.

props.synopsis: The Socceroos remain a work in progress, according to coach Tony Popopvic, after a posting a 5-1 win over Indonesia in their latest World Cup qualifier in Sydney.

title.children: Socceroos taking 'strides forward' towards securing World Cup qualification

image.altText: A close up of Dichen Lachman in a medical chair in Severance.

props.synopsis: Australian Severance star Dichen Lachman, who plays Mark's wife Gemma, takes us behind the scenes as the epic 76-minute series finale, Cold Harbor, finally hits our screens.

title.children: Severance's Australian star would never go through the procedure

image.altText: A composite image of a man wearing an AFL vest with his arms crossed and a woman in a soccer shirt holding a ball.

props.synopsis: For professional athletes, an injury can be devastating. Lydia Williams and Bob Murphy share how they moved past the pain.

title.children: Two sporting legends share how they moved past injuries to reach new heights
